comment: She does not have the students best interest in mind. She truly does not care about her students in any way. Shell treat you like a child and expect you to act like an adult. If there was an option I would have never taken her class. She really tries to trick you and loves to watch you struggle.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Material is hard; yet, it is not impossible. She is not easily persuaded. What she deems is correct typically stands. Case studies are over what is presented in class. I failed most but still earned a 94%. ATI quizzes prepare you for proctored ATI which is heavily weighted. Test questions were fair and straightforward. Great instructor!!

Case studies are pop quizzes. Tests are weird because its only 50 questions with over a 1,000 facts to remember. Sometimes questions are asked based on what the professor knows, not what we were taught. She does not really care about your success and she doesn't work on the weekend although her quizzes open on Sunday morning.

Had her w/ pharm & holistic. Passionate about nursing, tons of experience as both a RN and a teacher. However, her stories can take up quite a bit of time and seem to be more for her ego vs our education (and don't always sound true). GO TO CLASS. She leaves stuff out of ppt on purpose for skippers and will NOT post later. Overall would take again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lecture was from PPTs, but tests were over lecture & the textbook. Contradicting information was offered on both platforms, but this was not taken into account when grading the exams. If you based your info off of the book when the answer was off of the PPT or vice versa, you failed. She was unwilling to accept her PPTs having wrong information.

She is great!! She is tough and makes you work for your grade, but really cares about her students and wants to make us great nurses. I learned alot in her lectures, and felt prepared for clinical! She tells lots of stories in class that actually help me remember information on tests!
I love Mrs. Nelson!!!  I enjoy going to her lectures. She makes me laugh and she tells stories that help me remember the important stuff.  I feel like she really wants us to succeed.
I really enjoyed her. She cares and is quite helpful. She reinforces things she wants to to remember/ items on tests.
When she lectured it was fun, but she talked too much about herself and nursing stories. She seems intimidating but is somewhat nice. Overall she is just okay when it comes to teaching material

What a fantastic teacher Mrs. Nelson is. She was the very first nursing teacher I ever met, and also my very first clinical instructor. She loves to see her students do well and really does care about your success. She gives a lot of good information in class so it is a good idea to attend her lectures. She has great stories and is never boring.
GO TO CLASS! her in class lectures are a lot more detailed than the ones posted on D2L. Great professor with great stories

Great teacher. Has a lot of enthusiasm and presents a great lecture. You will never be bored and you will learn a lot.  Her test questions can be very tricky. Go to class, she doesn't put all the material on the powerpoints until you are in class and doesn't make them available after class. What she puts on the slides in class is what you need.
Fantastic professor! Always has interesting stories, loves to see students succeed.
